head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 3 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Evagrius. Selections from the writings of Evagrius; Xystus, bishop of Rome. The first discourse of Xystus, bishop of Rome; Extracts from several Fathers; John the monk. Writings of John the monk; Basil. Extract from a letter of Basil to an ascetic; .... In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 42 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Selections from the writings of Evagrius
First discourse
msItem.note: Imperfect at the beginning. See Add. 14,578 , no. 41.

msItem.title: Second discourse
msItem.incipit: ܝܕܥ̇ ܐܢܬ ܐ̃ܘ ܐܚܝ

msItem.title: Third discourse
msItem.incipit: ܒܟܠ ܥܕܢ̣ ܗܘ̣ܝܬ̇ ܥܗܝܕ ܠܫܘ̈ܘܕܝܟ̇. ܕܠܐ ܬܡܐܢ.

msItem.title: Heads of counsel and admonition
msItem.rubric: ܪ̈ܝܫܐ ܕܡ̣̈ܠܟܐ ܘܕܡܪ̈ܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܕܚܫܚܝܢ ܠܟܠ ܡ̈ܘܫܚ̣ܢ ܘܠܟܠ ܪ̈ܥܝܢܝܢ
msItem.incipit: ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܫܪܐ ܒܬܩܢܘܬܐ̣. ܐܘܪܚܐ ܗܝ ܩܫܝܬܐ ܘܥܣܩܬ ܠܗ̈ܠܟܬܐ̇. ܘܡܠܝܬ ܥܡ̈ܠܐ ܘܕܘ̈ܥܬܐ̇. ܘܣܒܝܣܬ ܒܐܘ̈ܠܨܢܐ ܣܓ̈ܝܐܐ. ܘܠܐ ܗܘܐ ܬܘܒ ܕܟܠܢܫ ܗܝ ܕܥܪܕܐ ܒܗ̇܇ ܡܛܠ ܡܙܩܦܘܬܐ ܕܥܣܩܘܬܗ̇. ܘܠܐ ܠܗ̇ܘ ܬܘܒ ܕܥ̣ܠ ܠܗ̇܇ ܕܠܝܠ ܠܗ ܕܠܪܝܫܗ̇ ܢܡ̣ܛܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܕܝܪܝܘܬܐ ܘܥܠ ܫܠܝܐ ܕܒܗ̇ ܘܕܐܝܟܢ ܡܬܩܢܝܐ

msItem.title: Another extract
msItem.incipit: ܠܬܠܬ ܦܢ̈ܝܢ ܡܬܥܠܐ ܐܘ ܡܬܬܚܬܐ ܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܐ ܡܠܝܠܬܐ

msItem.title: A short extract
msItem.incipit: ܐܢ ܕܝܢ ܪܓܝܓܐ ܠܟ ܨܠܘܬܐ ܕܟܝܬܐ̣: ܛܪ ܢܦܫܟ ܡܢ ܚܡܬܐ.
msItem.quote: ܥܠ ܚܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܟܘ̈ܢܫܐ ܕܟܠܓܢܣ.
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܡܡܠܠܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܘܠܒܝ̣ܫ ܠܡܫܝܚܐ. ܐܒܐ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ: ܐܝܚܝܕܝܐ. ܨܠܘܬܗ ܥܠܝܢ ܒܟܠܙܒܢ ܐܡܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ:܀.
msItem.note: On fol. 19 b we have the new title.

msItem.title: This is the discourse addressed to Eulogius.
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
msItem.rubric: ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ. ܠܘܬ ܝܚ̈ܝܕܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ ܥܡܪܝܢ
msItem.note: Comprising ܥܠ ܗܠܝܢ ܬܡ̈ܢܝܐ ܚ̈ܘܫܒܝܢ and ܕܥܠ ܚ̈ܫܐ. See Add. 14,578 , no. 2.

msItem.title: Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
msItem.rubric: ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ. ܕܠܘܬ ܐܚ̈ܐ ܕܐܟܚܕܐ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܥܡܪܝܢ
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܡܐܐ ܘܚ̈ܡܫܝܢ ܪܝܫ̈ܝܢ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܘܓܪܝܣ ܛܘܒܢܐ.

msItem.title: Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
msItem.incipit: ܠܘ ܒܟܠܙܒܢ ܡܫܟܚܝܢ ܚܢܢ ܕܢܫ̇ܠܡ ܬܫܡܫܬܐ ܕܥܝܕܢ

msItem.title: On the things that happen in dreams
msItem.incipit: ܐܡܬܝ ܕܒܫܪ̈ܓܪܓܝܬܐ ܕܫܢ̣ܬܐ ܒܡ̇ܢܬܐ ܕܪܓܬܐ ܡܩܪ̈ܒܝܢ ܥܡ ܕܝ̈ܘܐ. ܐܡܬܝ ܕܗ̣ܢܘܢ ܡܚܘܝ̣ܢ. ܚܢܢ ܕܝܢ ܪܗ̣ܛܝܢܢ ܒܬܪܗܘܢ. ܘ܏ܫ.

msItem.title: Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
Part of Selections from the writings of Evagrius
msItem.rubric: ܡܠܦܢܘܬܐ ܘܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܗ̈ܠܝܢ ܬܡ̈ܢܝܐ ܚܫ̈ܝܢ

msItem.title: The first discourse of Xystus, bishop of Rome
msItem.rubric: ܡܡܠܠܐ ܕܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܟܣܘܣܛܘܣ ܐ܏ܦܝܣ ܕܪܗܘܡܐ

msItem.title: Extracts from several Fathers
On humility
On repentance
From the treatise on the priesthood
msItem.rubric: ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܗܘܢܝܣ ܡܢ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܟܗܢܘܬܐ

msItem.title: Part of Extracts from several Fathers
Part of Extracts from several Fathers
Part of Extracts from several Fathers
Part of Extracts from several Fathers
On prayer
msItem.incipit: ܐܝܢܐ ܕܩܐ̇ܡ ܒܨܠܘܬܐ ܢܗܘܐ ܡ̇ܨܠܐ ܠܒܗ ܥܡ ܦܘܡܗ. ܘܪܥܝܢܗ ܥܡ ܣ̈ܦܘܬܗ.

msItem.title: From the discourse on Joshua
msItem.rubric: ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ: ܕܥܠ ܝܫܘܥ ܒܪܢܘܢ ܟܕ ܡ̇ܦܫܩ ܠܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܡܪ ܕܘܝܕ: ܕܒܩܝܬܪܐ ܥܣܪ̈ ܡ̈ܢܝܢ ܐܙܡ̇ܪ ܠܟ

msItem.title: Writings of John the monk
An extract
msItem.incipit: ܒܟܠܗ ܓܝܪ ܕܘܒܪܐ ܕܐܘܢܓܠܝܘܢ ܐܢ ܢܗܠܟ̣. ܠܐ ܝܐܐ ܕܢܣ̣ܒܪ ܕܐܝܬ ܠܢ ܡܕܡ ܕܡܛܠܬܗ ܢܬܚ̣ܢܢ. ܐܠܐ ܐܢ ܒܪ̈ܚܡܘܗܝ ܕܐܠܗܐ. ܐܝܟ ܕܠܐ ܓܝܪ ܐܝܬ ܠܢ ܥ̣ܠܬܐ ܐܚܪܬܐ ܕܢܐܡܪ ܕܡܛܠܬܗ̇ ܒܪܢ ܐܠܗܐ: ܐܠܐ ܐܢ ܒܠܚܘܕ ܡܛܠ ܛܝܒܘܬܗ̣. ܗܟܢܐ ܐܦܠܐ ܥܠܬܐ ܐܚܪܬܐ ܐܝܬ ܠܢ̇. ܢܬܚ̇ܫܒ ܕܡܛܠܬܗ̇ ܢܚܐ̇. ܐܠܐ ܐܢ ܒܠܚܘܕ ܡܛܠ ܛܝܒܘܬܗ ܕܗ̣ܝ ܫܪܝ̣ܬ݀ ܒܟܪܝܘܬܢ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: The first dialogue with Eutropius and Eusebius
msItem.rubric: ܕܝܠܗ ܢܝ̈ܫܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܢܐ ܥܠ ܢܦܫܐ ܘܥܠ ܦܘܪܫ ܚ̈ܫܐ ܕܒ̈ܢܝܢܫܐ: ܦܓܪ̈ܢܐ ܘܢ̈ܦܢܫܐ ܘܪ̈ܘܚܢܐ

msItem.title: The third dialogue with the same
msItem.note: See Add. 17,169 , no. 3, c. Here it is unfinished.

msItem.title: On tranquillity
msItem.rubric: ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܝܘܚܢܢ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܕܥܠ ܫܠ̣ܝܐ
msItem.incipit: ܓܡܝܪܘܬܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ ܐܝ̇ܕܐ ܕܒܝܕܥܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܘܬܐ ܡܫܬܡܠܝܐ

msItem.title: On prayer
msItem.incipit: ܐܘّ ܐܚܘܢ ܠܐ ܬܣ̣ܒܪ ܕܨܠܘܬܐ ܡ̈ܠܐ ܒܠܚܘܕ ܐܝܬܝܗ̇: ܘܠܐ ܬܣ̣ܒܪ ܕܒ̈ܡܠܐ ܡܬܝܠܦܐ. ܫܡ̣ܥ ܕܝܢ ܡܢܝ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܫܪܝܪܐ. ܨܠܘܬܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܬܐ ܡܢ ܝܘܠܦܢܐ ܘܬܢ̣ܝܐ ܕܡ̈ܠܐ ܠܐ ܡܬܓܡܪܐ.

msItem.title: Letter to Hesychius
msItem.rubric: ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܗܘܣܝܟܣ ܛܘܒܢܐ̇. ܕܐܝܟܢ ܘ̇ܠܐ ܠܗ ܕܢܗܘܐ ܒܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܕܡܝܬܪܘܬܐ: ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܕܝܢ ܕܐܙܠ̣ ܡܢ ܠܘܬܗ ܟ̣ܬܒ ܠܗ ܟܕ ܐܡ̇ܪ ܗܟܢܐ

msItem.title: Extract from a letter of Basil to an ascetic
msItem.rubric: ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܒܣܝܠܝܣ܆ ܐܦܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܣܪܝܐ ܡܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܠܘܬ ܐܢܫ ܥܢܘܝܐ
msItem.incipit: ܕܐܢܫ ܓܝܪ ܕܡܢ ܝܘܩܪܐ ܕܫܢ̣ܬܐ ܢܬܛ̇ܒܥ ܒܫ̣ܢܬܐ. ܘܢܫܬܪ̈ܘܢ ܗܕܡ̈ܘܗܝ܆ ܐܝܟ ܕܢܬܠ ܐܬܪܐ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܠܚܠܡ̈ܐ ܡܫܟܪ̈ܐ̣. ܠܡܘܬܐ ܕܟܠܝܘܡ ܡ̇ܫܬܥܒܕ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Two discourses of Jacob of Batnae
On Solitaries
msItem.incipit: ܪܡܐ ܡܫܘܚܬܐ ܕܝܚ̈ܝܕܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܠ ܬܓܡ̈ܝܢ

msItem.title: On the Resurrection of the Dead
msItem.incipit: ܐܥܝܪ ܒܝ ܡܪܝ ܩ̈ܠܐ ܦܫܝ̈ܛܐ ܕܡܠܦܢܘܬܐ.

msItem.title: Two discourses, here ascribed to Ephraim, but in reality by Isaac of Antioch
On Solitaries
msItem.incipit: ܐܠܗܐ ܕܬܩ̣ܠ ܛܘܼܪ̈ܐ

msItem.title: On the perfection of brethren
msItem.incipit: ܒܩܪܒܐ ܟ̈ܐܢܐ ܪܡ̇ܝܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ

msItem.title: A discourse of Ephraim on those who keep vigils
msItem.incipit: ܒܦܚ̈ܐ ܢܫܪ̈ܐ ܡܬܬܨܝܕܝܢ. ܘܒܓܘ ܫܢ̣ܬܐ ܫܗܪ̈ܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: A discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the Prodigal Son
msItem.rubric: ܕܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܒܪܐ ܐܣܘܛܐ: ܕܦ̇ܪܚ ܢܟ̈ܣܘܗܝ
msItem.incipit: ܦܬ̣ܚ ܡ݅ܪܢ ܠܝ݅ ܬܪܥܐ ܪܒܐ ܕܬܝܒܘܬܐ
msItem.note: It is imperfect at the end.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 in. by 5 1/2, consisting of 154 leaves, a few of which are slightly stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 136, and 154. The quires are 16 in number, of which the first two and the last two are without signatures. The remainder are signed with letters from ܐ (fol. 28 b) to ܝܒ (fol. 127 a), but arithmetical figures have been subsequently added on foll. 29 a (�) and 39 a (��). The volume is imperfect at the beginning, and leaves are wanting after foll. 8 and 136. The number of lines in each page varies from 20 to 32. Foll. 137—154, are palimpsest (see Add. 18817, foll. 137-154 upper text and Add. 18817, foll. 137-154 lower text ). The original description of this manuscript by William Wright includes characters, symbols, or illustrations which cannot be represented. Please consult the attached image, vol. 2, p. 803.

collation.p: The quires are 16 in number, of which the first two and the last two are without signatures. The remainder are signed with letters from ܐ (fol. 28 b) to ܝܒ (fol. 127 a), but arithmetical figures have been subsequently added on foll. 29 a() and 39 a().

item.p: 136 leaves, a few of which are slightly stained and torn, especially foll. 1 and 136. The volume is imperfect at the beginning, and leaves are wanting after foll. 8 and 136.

layout.p: The number of lines in each page varies from 20 to 32.

handDesc.handNote: The first portion of this volume (foll. 1—19 a) is written in a good hand of the ixth cent.
The remainder in a neat, cursive character, of about the same date.

head.note: This manuscript contains: John the monk. A doctrine of John the monk; Marcus the monk. The first discourse of Marcus the monk on the Spiritual Law; Philoxenus of Mabūg. A letter of Philoxenus of Mabūg to a disciple; Extracts from "the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers". In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 4 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A doctrine of John the monk
msItem.rubric: ܕܝܘܚܢܢ. ܝܚܕܝܐ ܡ̇ܠܦܢܘܬܐ ܕܟܠ ܪ̈ܥܝܢܝܢ. ܕܐܡ̣ܝܪܐ ܠܗ ܒܢ̈ܝ̣ܫܐ ܣܓ̈ܝܐܐ. ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܠܚܕ ܚܕ ܡܢܗܘܢ̣. ܡܠܘܐܐ ܕܦܬܓ̈ܡܐ ܒܣܘܟܠܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܫܟܚܬܐ ܕܪܚܡ̣ܬ. ܐܠܗܐ̣. ܩܢܝ̣ܢܐ ܗܝ ܕܡ̇ܠܟ̣ܘܬܗ

msItem.title: The first discourse of Marcus the monk on the Spiritual Law
msItem.rubric: ܕܡܪܩܘܣ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܥܠ ܡܝܬܪܘܬܐ̣ ܘܥܠ ܢܡܘܣܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܐ

msItem.title: A letter of Philoxenus of Mabūg to a disciple
msItem.rubric: ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ. ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܐܢܫ ܬܠܡܝܕܐ ܕܝܠܗ
msItem.incipit: ܡܠܬܗ ܕܫܠ̣ܝܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܬܢ̇ܐ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܥܡ ܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ̣. ܕܚ̇ܕܐ ܐܢܐ ܕܫܡ̇ܥ ܐܢܐ ܡܛܟܣܘܬܐ ܕܕܘܒܪ̈ܝܟ̇. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: Extracts from "the Lives of the Egyptian Fathers"
msItem.incipit: ܩܪܝ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ̣ ܥܕܡܐ ܠܘܬ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܢܬ݀ܟܢܫ ܗܘܢܟ ܡܢ ܦܗܝܐ. ܘܒܬܪ ܗܠܝܢ ܩܘܡ ܘܐܬܦܢܝ ܠܨܠܘܬܐ̣. ܐܝܟܢܐ ܕܢܗܼܘܐ ܩܪܝܢܟ ܡܛܠ ܨܠܘܬܐ܂ ܘܗ̇ܝܕܝܢ ܐܬܦܢܝ ܠܥܒ̇ܕܐ ܕܐܝ̈ܕܝܟ̣. ܘܠܗܘܓܝܐ ܕܡ̈ܠܐ ܕܡܢ ܐܒܗ̈ܬܐ ܐܬܬܣ̣̈ܝܡܢ ܒܟ. ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 in. by 5 1/2, consisting of 18 leaves, a few of which are slightly stained and torn, especially foll. 154. These leaves are palimpsest (see Add. 18817, foll. 137-154 lower text ).

collation.p: The last two quires,foll. 137—154, are palimpsest.

item.p: Palimpsest, the upper text of which is of the xiith cent.

layout.p: The number of lines in each page varies from 20 to 32.

handDesc.handNote: Foll. 137—154 are palimpsest of the xiith cent

head.note: This manuscript contains: Undetermined manuscript item. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Undetermined manuscript item
msItem.note: The underlying text seems originally to have formed part of the first portion of this manuscript, which is now imperfect at the beginning.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 in. by 5 1/2, consisting of 18 leaves, a few of which are slightly stained and torn, especially foll. 154. These leaves are palimpsest (see Add. 18817, foll. 137-154 upper text ). The underlying text seems originally to have formed part of the first portion of this manuscript, which is now imperfect at the beginning.

collation.p: The last two quires,foll. 137—154, are palimpsest.

item.p: The underlying text seems originally to have formed part of the first portion of this manuscript, which is now imperfect at the beginning.

layout.p: The number of lines in each page varies from 20 to 32.

handDesc.handNote: The underlying text is most plainly legible on foll. 138 a, 143 b, and 149 a. It seems to have originally formed part of the first portion of this manuscript.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
